29. Vespasiano. Otho had been succeeded, after a short reign, by Vitellius, and he in turn by Vespasian‚ governor of Judaea. Ves- pasiaffs general, Licinius Mucianus, governor of Syria, led the advance against Vitellius, overthrew his power, and administered affairs in Rome for some time before Vespasian arrived in Italy from the East. All these events took place A.D. 69.
